content.prompt: The eventual adoption of Cobden's ideas by the British government contributed most directly to which of the following developments in the late nineteenth century?

choices.label: The increase in social tensions between the land-owning aristocracy and other classes in Great Britain
The growth of a global economic network
The increasing incidence of famine due to decreased food production in Great Britain
The rising desire for national self-determination among ethnic minorities

topic.text: 6.3: Second Wave Industrialization and Its Effects
